text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm today we are doing five-spice
carrots i've had some requests for some
easy vegetable side dishes and this is
one so there's your carrots i get seven
of them and there is my chinese
five-spice five spice mix except when i
turned it around it had seven spices i
can't explain it i got two bonus spices
all right pre-heat your oven to 375 now
to prep your carrots we're gonna do
what's called a bias cut we're gonna cut
it on a diagonal i had one small carrot
so that when i just cut in half on that
bias the other ones the larger carrots i
had a cut in half lengthwise and then I
did my bias cut now later when these
roasts you're gonna see those little
kind of pointy bits get a little bit
extra kind of chewy and not crispy but a
little different texture the ingredients
so simple
about a tablespoon or two of vegetable
oil about 1/2 a teaspoon of the
five-spice I mean 7 spice all right a
little bit of salt maybe half a teaspoon
that's to taste I always say that you
know that give it a toss with your hand
is the best tool for this and when
they're all evenly coated what you want
to do is play carrots ah puzzle you want
to get them kind of all lined up and
fitting in all the right grooves so
they're kind of evenly spaced so they
cook evenly all right throw them in the
oven about a half-hour to 40 minutes one
optional step all right if you want to
you can pull them out halfway through
and give them a toss with your tongues
and kind of check how done they are but
that's optional and about a half hour
forty minutes you are gonna have these
amazingly aromatic delicious five-spice
I mean seven roast carrots this is such
a great side dish I served this with
that brisket you saw me cook a few days
ago really good really exotic but you
know familiar not too exactly
so anyway go to the site read the
article get the recipe and most of all
enjoy
you
